Lilia Review | Bon Appetit

Some of our favorites include the long strands of ridged mafaldini with aromatic pink peppercorns; tender agnolotti filled with sheep's milk cheese and a bathed in a delicate honey-based sauce; and the saucy rigatoni diavola for a bit of heat. Of course, you could also round things out with some huge, buttery grilled scallops or seasonal crudité with a salty anchovy bagna cauda. And to finish things off, the immaculate Italian Job—soft-serve gelato, sea salt, honey, olive oil, and fennel pollen—is a dessert unlike any you've ever tasted.WORD TO THE WISE: Put in a special request for the off-menu eggs, scrambled soft and slow with crème fraiche, whipped ricotta, and Parmesan (and topped with black truffle shavings, for good measure). If Robbins is in the house—and in the mood for it—she might just whip up this signature dish for you.THE VIBE IS: high-brow Brooklyn. Wedged into an odd triangular island at the intersection of several streets, the airy, sophisticated space is ideal for a special ocassion, be it a family celebration or an anniversary date.PRACTICAL STUFF: Reservations can be made through Resy or by phone. Lilia Caffé, which serves pastries, coffee, and paninis (from 11:30 a.m. to 4 p.m.), opens at 7 a.m. daily. The restaurant is open 5:30 to 11:00 p.m. Monday to 5:00 to 11:00 p.m. on Saturday and Sunday.Evan SungEvan SungWE ALSO LOVEThe CommodoreBrooklyn’s ultimate fried chicken sandwich and piña coladas—who needs classy?OkonomiJapanese breakfast and ramen, all in one perfect Williamsburg spotAchilles HeelThe non-restaurant restaurant that’s worth the trek to GreenpointExplore City GuidesAtlantaAustinBostonCharlestonChicagoCopenhagenLas VegasLondonLos AngelesMexico CityMiamiMontrealNew OrleansNew YorkParisPhiladelphiaPortlandSan FranciscoSeattleTokyoTorontoVancouverWashington, D.C.GET THE MAGAZINEBA LogoBon appetitSUBSCRIBESign up for Updates on the Bon AppétitCity GuidesSign UpWill be used in accordance with our user agreement and privacy policyBA LogoBon appetitSubscription FAQsMastheadNewsletter SignupAccessibility HelpRSS FeedsSite MapCondé Nast StoreCareersBon Appétit Media KitDo Not Sell My Personal InformationCondé NastFood Innovation Group: Bon Appétit and Epicurious© 2022 Condé Nast.
